problem.markdown:
>>A cloud can create a negative or positive climate feedback loop depending on the:<<
( ) temperature and volume of the cloud (x) albedo and altitude of the cloud ( ) color and surface area of the cloud ( ) width and shape of the cloud ( ) transparency and temperature of the cloud
[explanation] A cloud can create a negative or positive climate feedback loop depending on its albedo and altitude. For example, a cloud with low albedo (low reflectivity) might act as a blanket, absorbing infrared radiation and warming the earth. A low lying cloud with a high albedo could reflect incoming solar radiation, cooling the earth. [explanation]
